required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healing of Punch Graft Wounds. Comparative Study Between MariGen and Oasis: a Non-inferiority Study
clinical_study.official_title: Healing of Punch Graft Wounds With Two Biologic Exracellular Matrices; a Non-inferiority Study

oversight_info.authority: Iceland: Ministry of Health and Social Security

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to determine, if healing of punch biopsy wounds treated with the fish skin derived MariGen Wound dressing is non-inferior to healing with wounds treated with pig intestines derived Oasis Sheet wound dressing. Secondary endpoints are: Incidence of erythema, Pain, Infection, Quantitative measurements of autoantibodies at baseline and 4 weeks after start of treatment

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of auto-antibodies including anti-collagen I and II antibodies

arm_group.description: Pig intestine derived extra cellular matrix

intervention.intervention_name: Punch biopsies treated with MariGen Wound ECM dressing
intervention.description: Weekly dressing changes and review of wounds.

intervention.intervention_name: Punch biopsies treated with Oasis ECM dressing
intervention.description: Weekly dressing changes and wound review

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 yrs
- Healthy individual
- Signature of informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Autoimmune disease
- Immunosuppressive treatment
- Use of addictive drugs
- Excessive use of alcohol
- Known fish allergy
- Known allergy to proteins with porcine origin
- Peripheral vascular disease
- Pregnant women
- Persons receiving anticoagulation therapy or systemic corticosteroids will be excluded.

overall_official.affiliation: The National University Hospital of Iceland
